meanings.definition: To strip of feathers or plumes.
meanings.sent1: The fierce wind displumes the bird, leaving it bare.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper carefully displumes the injured bird for examination.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tries to displume the feather duster, thinking it's a toy.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fury displumes the trees, scattering their leaves far and wide.
meanings.sent5: Watching the magician displume the dove was both mesmerizing and unsettling.

meanings.definition: To strip of honors or privileges.
meanings.sent1: The scandalous revelation displumes the once-respected politician.
meanings.sent2: The king had the power to displume any noble who dared to defy him.
meanings.sent3: Losing the game of chess felt like a defeat that would displume his title of champion.
meanings.sent4: The economic crisis threatened to displume the company of its prestigious status.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal by his closest friend displumed him of his trust in others.
